metadata.Description: Energy systems that generate and distribute energy at a local level, often using renewable sources and involving local communities in decision-making and ownership.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Approaches and initiatives that are driven and implemented by local communities to address sustainable energy challenges and meet their specific needs.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.

Microgrids are a sub-component of decentralized energy systems. They are small-scale power grids that can operate independently or in conjunction with the main power grid. They provide localized energy generation and distribution, increasing energy resilience and reducing transmission losses.
relations.Subject: microgrids

relations.Description: Off-grid systems are a type of decentralized energy system that operate independently from the main power grid. They typically rely on renewable energy sources and are commonly used in remote areas where grid connection is not feasible. Off-grid systems provide access to electricity in underserved communities.
relations.Subject: off-grid systems

relations.Description: Distributed generation is a key component of decentralized energy systems. It refers to the generation of electricity from multiple small-scale sources located near the point of consumption. Distributed generation reduces transmission losses, enhances energy security, and promotes renewable energy integration.
relations.Subject: distributed generation

relations.Description: Energy storage is an essential part of decentralized energy systems. It involves the capture and storage of excess energy for later use. Energy storage technologies enable the integration of intermittent renewable energy sources, enhance grid stability, and support load management.
relations.Subject: energy storage

relations.Description: Smart grids are a category of decentralized energy systems. They utilize advanced communication and control technologies to optimize the generation, distribution, and consumption of electricity. Smart grids enable efficient energy management, demand response, and integration of renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: smart grids
